* A class that contains helper functions used to process user inputs. It also contains UserInputException
* that is used across the project to handle the unexpected user input.
* Parse the user/file input as command. It returns a command that is not yet executed. It also needs to
* get a UI from Duke to display the messages.
* @param input the user/file input that is to be parsed to a command
* @return the parse result, which is a command ready to be executed
ui.showError("Please enter index of task after \'done\'");
ui.showError("Please enter index of task after \'delete\'");
ui.showError("Please enter keyword for searching after \'find\'");
private static int parseIndex(String input) throws NumberFormatException, UserInputException {
throw new UserInputException("Please enter task index");
* Parse the specific part of a user/file input that is relevant to a task. A successful parsing always

* @param input    user/file input ready to be parsed
* @return an AddCommand of the task parsed from the input
* @throws UserInputException an exception when the parsing is failed, probably due to the wrong format of

* An type of exception dedicated to handling the unexpected user/file input. The message contains more
public static class UserInputException extends Exception {

* Storage class contains the helper functions that is used to interact with the file storing the task
* This function clear the content of the file and write all the information of the tasks in the task list
* to that file. This file follows similar structure as the user input and can be used to re-construct the
* @param taskList the list of task that is to be written to the file
System.out.println("Write to output file IO exception!");
* This function read the file that is previously saved to re-construct and return the task list from the
* file information. Note: if any error occurs during the reading or parsing of the file, an empty task
* list will always be returned for the integrity of data.
* @return task list re-constructed from the save file
return taskList; //it is acceptable if there is no save file
* Exception that belongs to the process of storing and reading of file.
public static class StorageException extends Exception {
* Instantiation of storage exception with a message, which can be later displayed by the UI.
* @param msg the message of the exception that can be displayed by UI
* Convert the exception to string by returning its message.
* TaskList class is the special type of ArrayList that contains Task and has some special functions used to
* manipulate the tasks in this list.
* Convert the task list to a string of the pre-determined format that is ready to be displayed by the
return "There is nothing in your list.";
String msg = "Here are the tasks in your list:";
* Search through all the tasks in the list to look for the keyword specified. The result will be the
* string containing all the task string that is ready to be displayed.
* @param keyword the target keyword for searching
* @return a string containing all the tasks found and is ready to be displayed by UI
msg += "Here are the matching tasks in your list:";
msg += "There is no matching task in your list.";
* Mark the task at the specified index in the task list as done.
* @param index the target index of which the task is to be marked as done
* @return a message that is ready to be displayed by UI
* @throws Parser.UserInputException an exception thrown when index parsing failed or out of range
public String markDone(int index) throws Parser.UserInputException {
String msg = "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n";
* Delete the task at the specified index in the task list.
* @param index the target index of which the task is to be deleted
* @return a message that is ready to be displayed by UI
* @throws Parser.UserInputException an exception thrown when index parsing failed or out of range
public String delete(int index) throws Parser.UserInputException {
String msg = "Noted. I've removed this task: \n";
msg += "Now you have " + this.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* Instantiate the UI component, which also display the welcoming message.
logo += "What can I do for you?";

* @param msg the message that is to be shown
* Show a message in the format of a response, which is in between two lines.

* Show an error message in the red color.

* Add Command is a specific kind of command used to add task to the task list.
* Instantiation of add command with all the necessary variables. it needs to execute.
* @param taskList the task list where the task is added to.
* @param taskType the type of task that is to be added.
* @param name     he name of the task, which is needed to instantiate the task.
* @param time     the time of the task, which is needed to instantiate the task. ToDo tasks does not have
*                 time attribute, so any Date can be passed in and will be ignored.
public AddCommand(TaskList taskList, Task.TaskType taskType, String name, Date time) {
* Execute the add command by instantiating the task first and then add the task to task list.
* @return a flag whether the task is successfully added. Returns false if the taskType is not recognised.
String msg = "Got it. I've added this task: \n";
msg += "Now you have " + taskList.size() + " task(s) in the list. ";
* This is an abstract command that all kinds of command inherit from. It has execute() function to be
* overridden and can be set silent for UI output.
* A flag whether UI output is turned off. Default to be false, so UI output is default to be turned on.
* Execute the command. This method is to be overridden to specific functionality by different types of
* @return a flag whether the command is successfully executed.
* This function turns off the UI output of the command.
* Delete Command that is used delete a task from the task list with its index.
* Instantiation of delete command with all the necessary variables.
* @param taskList the task list where the task is added to.
* @param index    the index of task that is to be deleted
* Execute the delete command by calling the delete function of task list.
* @return a flag whether deletion is done successfully. Returns false if the delete function of task list
* Done Command is a specific kind of command used to mark a task as done.
* Instantiation of done command with the index of the target task.
* @param i the index of the target task to be marked as done
* Execute the done command by calling the markDone function of the task list.
* @return a flag whether the task is successfully marked as done. Returns false if the markDone function
* Exit Command is a special kind of command called when the user ends the interaction.
* Simply returns false when executed. s
* Find Command is a specific kind of command used to find a task from task list with a keyword.
* Instantiation of find command with all the necessary variables it needs to execute.
* @param taskList the task list where the task is looked for
* @param keyword  the keyword that the target task needs to match
* Execute the find command by calling the findKeyword function from the task list. Find result will be
* @return true after the look after is completed. Note that no result found will be reflected in the UI
*      output instead of the returned value of this function.
* Invalid Command is a specific kind of command indicating the input is not recognised as any known command.
* Simply return false. The UI output is currently disabled.
* List Command is a specific kind of command used to display all task in a task list.
* Instantiation of the list command with the target task list.
* @param taskList the target task list to be displayed.
* Execute the list command by calling the UI to display the target task list.
* Deadline is a type of task with a date/time which is the deadline time.
* Instantiate the Deadline with the name and the time. Time must be in during the instantiation as it
* Function that convert the Deadline to a human readable string containing important information about
* the Deadline, including the type and time of this Deadline.
* @return a human readable string containing the important information
* Functions that output a string with all the information of this Deadline to be stored in a file for
* @return a string containing all information of this Deadline
* A function that output a formatted string of the time of this Deadline. The format is the same as input
* format and is shared by all tasks.
* @return a formatted string of the time of this Deadline
* Event class is a typ of task with a date/time when the event is going to happen.
* Instantiate the Event class with name and time. Time must be passed in during the instantiation as it
* @param time time of the Event that is going to happen
* Function that convert the Event to a human readable string containing important information about the
* Event, including the type and time of this Event.
* @return a human readable string containing the important information
* Functions that output a string with all the information of this Event to be stored in a file for future
* @return a string containing all information of this Event
* A function that outputs a formatted string of the time of this Event. The format is the same as input
* format and is shared by all tasks.
* @return a formatted string of the time of this Event

* The flag whether is task is already done. Can only be set from false to true.
* The type of the task, following the enumeration declared.
* A date format that is shared by all tasks to parse and out the date involved in the task.
* The enumeration of all task type.

* @param name the name of the task

* @return the human readable string of the basic information the task.
* The function to convert the task to a human readable string. This will return the same string as the
* get status function for a basic task, but is overridden by more advanced task class to add more
* @return a human readable string that contains all important information of a task.
* The function returns a string that contains full information of the task which is used to be stored in
* @return a string containing full information of the task.
* The function is used to parse the input string to a Date that is used by the tasks with time involved.
* The function can be called before the initialization of a Task so that the Data can be directly passed
* @param dateString an input string to be parsed
* @return parsed result from the input string
* @throws ParseException an exception when the parsing is failed, most likely due to a wrong format
public static Date parseDate(String dateString) throws ParseException {
